headline: Michael Karkoc, 100, a Retired Carpenter Who Was Exposed as a Nazi War Criminal
abstract: Before he was found to have led a Nazi-controlled unit of Ukrainians in a massacre of Polish villagers in 1944, he had lived quietly in Minneapolis for decades.
lead_paragraph: Michael Karkoc, a retired Minnesota carpenter who was exposed as a former commander of a Nazi-led unit that was accused of atrocities in World War II, died on Dec. 14, public and cemetery records show. He was 100.
keywords: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
